thread.title: Aetna to buy Humanna for $37bn as US health insurance bonanza rolls on
thread.title_full: Aetna to buy Humanna for $37bn as US health insurance bonanza rolls on

title: Aetna to buy Humanna for $37bn as US health insurance bonanza rolls on
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Jul 3, 2015, 10:06 BST - UK Markets close in 6 hrs 24 mins Aetna to buy Humanna for $37bn as US health insurance bonanza rolls on Sharecast â€“ 13 minutes ago 187.50 -5.64 
LONDON (ShareCast) - US health insurer Aetna Inc (NYSE: AET - news ) has agreed to take over rival Humana Inc (NYSE: HUM - news ) for roughly $37bn, capping off a frantic week of mergers and acquisitions (M&A) in the sector. Hertford, Connecticut-based Atena will pay about $230 per share, a 23% premium to the stock's closing price on Thursday, in a cash-and-stock deal for its Louisville, Kentucky-headquartered peer. 
Sector rumour-mongers had been citing Aetna as a possible target for Minneapolis-headquartered UnitedHealth, indicating the deal may yet be derailed. 
Humana shareholders will receive $125 in cash and 0.8375 Aetna shares for each share held and following the deal, Aetna's shareholders would own about 74% of the combined company. 
This follows Thursday's agreement by fellow health insurer Centene (NYSE: CNC - news ) to acquire rival Health Net (NYSE: HNT - news ) for $6.3bn, while reports also suggested Anthem (NYSE: ANTM - news ) and Cigna (NYSE: CI - news ) had met for merger talks. 
Companies in the health insurance sector are looking to capitalise on the booming market, having benefited from a surge of new business as the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act pushed previously uninsured people into paying for protection.
